required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of SHR6390 Combined With Famitinib in the Treatment of HR + / HER2- Advanced Breast Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: An Exploratory Study of CDK4/6 Inhibitor SHR6390 Combined With Famitinib in the Treatment of HR + / HER2- Advanced Breast Cancer.

lead_sponsor.agency: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

clinical_study.source: Tianjin Medical University Cancer Institute and Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: The study is being conducted to assess the efficacy and safety of SHR6390 combined with famitinib in the treatment of advanced or metastatic breast cancer that progress in 1-2 line endocrine therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: This is a single-center, single-arm, open-label, Simon's two-stage design, phase II clinical trial. The purpose of this study was to evaluate the efficacy and safety of SHR6390 combined with famitinib in the treatment of HR+/HER2 advanced or metastatic breast cancer patients who have progressed during or after 1-2 line endocrine therapy. Subjects will be treated until disease progression, toxicity is intolerable, informed consent is withdrawn, and investigators determine that medication must be discontinued. Drug efficacy and safety data will be collected.

primary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 30 months.
primary_outcome.description: ORR is defined as the proportion of patients who achieved a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) according to RECIST 1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization in participants with measurable disease at baseline through the end of study (12 months after the last participant is enrolled).
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical benefit defined as Complete Response (CR), Partial Response (PR) or Stable Disease (SD) lasting >= 24 weeks, as determined by the Investigator according to RECIST v1.1.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From date of randomization until the date of first documented progression or date of death from any cause, whichever came first, assessed up to 30 months.
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the time from the first CR or PR to the first assessment of PD or death, whichever comes first.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Randomization to the first occurrence of disease progression as determined by the investigator according to (RECIST v1.1 ) or death from any cause, until the end of study (12 months after the last participant is enrolled)

Randomization to the first occurrence of disease progression as determined by the investigator according to (RECIST v1.1 ) or death from any cause, until the end of study (12 months after the last participant is enrolled)
From the first medication to 28 days after the end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Safety will be assessed using NCI Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events v5.0 (CTCAE) for reporting laboratory and non-laboratory toxicities.

arm_group.description: Participants will receive SHR6390 in combination with famitinib.

intervention.description: SHR6390 is a novel small molecule inhibitor specifically targeting the CDK4/6 pathway.
Famitinib is a tyrosin-inhibitor agent targeting at c-Kit, VEGFR2, PDGFR, VEGFR3, Flt1 and Flt3.
